p: In accordance with our aim to discover “successful” dynamic invariants for the transient state [ 12, 13], which would be alternative to the Born-Oppenheimer adiabatic invariants — potential energy surfaces, we search for the solution of the Schrödinger Eq. (20) for the “electron + environment” system by Green's function technique. At the initial stage of constructing this solution, the identical transformations of Eq. (20) in the Green's function method can be considered as alternatives to identical transformations when the non-adiabaticity operator (23) is singled out in the Born-Oppenheimer method (see Section 2.4.1): if the purpose of the latter is to separate the slow motion nuclei from the rapid motion of an electron, the purpose of the former is to maximally preserve the interconnection of electronic and nuclear movements.
